docs.snippet: The antipathy of South Americans to North American products is passing away slowly but surely, especially so since the European war began. The Germans had the major portion of the trade, especially in Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, Paraguay and Chile....
docs.lead_paragraph: The antipathy of South Americans to North American products is passing away slowly but surely, especially so since the European war began. The Germans had the major portion of the trade, especially in Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay, Paraguay and Chile. They sold their goods very much cheaper than America could afford to sell, but their goods were of an inferior quality and their machinery very poorly constructed and short lived.
docs.abstract: letter of H. H. Thomas on Latin pyschology to be learned by American merchants; German method; German products vs. American products

headline.main: HINTS ON SOUTH AMERICA.; Much the American Has to Learn, Especially Latin Psychology.

headline.main: AGREE ON TERMS OF MEXICO NOTES; Each of Seven Nations Will Send Appeal to Leaders and State Governors. MEETINGS TO BE HELD HERE Second Conference Fails to Settle Important Questions -- Lansing to Report to Wilson. SCOTT GOES TO SEE VILLA Sudden Visit to Border Said to be in the Interest of American Towns Again in Danger. AGREE ON TERMS OF MEXICO NOTES

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7. -- Robert Lansing, Secretary of State, left for New York tonight to confer there tomorrow with William G. McAdoo, Secretary of the Treasury. It is suspected that their meeting will have a bearing on the effort to settle the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7. -- Robert Lansing, Secretary of State, left for New York tonight to confer there tomorrow with William G. McAdoo, Secretary of the Treasury. It is suspected that their meeting will have a bearing on the effort to settle the Mexican troubles, with particular reference to the financial aspects.

headline.main: LANSING TO CONFER ON MEXICO FUNDS; Will Meet McAdoo Here Today to Discuss Financing of New Government. CARRANZA EXPELS GUATEMALA ENVOY

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7. -- It is supposed here that the action of Gen. Caranza in giving his passports to the Guatemalan Minister in Mexico City was due to resentment among members of the Caranza Government over the participation of Guatemala in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7. -- It is supposed here that the action of Gen. Caranza in giving his passports to the Guatemalan Minister in Mexico City was due to resentment among members of the Caranza Government over the participation of Guatemala in the peace conferences held this week.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8. -- Secretary Lansing, who left here last night in response to Secretary McAdoo's request to meet him in New York, returned to Washington this evening. It was said after his return that while the effort
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8. -- Secretary Lansing, who left here last night in response to Secretary McAdoo's request to meet him in New York, returned to Washington this evening. It was said after his return that while the effort

headline.main: ENVOYS TO MEET HERE THIS WEEK; Will Continue Mexico Conferences With Lansing -- Carranza Reports Extending Power. TROOPS TO QUELL MEXICAN BANDITS

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9. -- "We have reached a stage where a very definite policy has been decided on," said Secretary Lansing today in announcing that the conference of representatives of the United States, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Bolivia, Uruguay, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9. -- "We have reached a stage where a very definite policy has been decided on," said Secretary Lansing today in announcing that the conference of representatives of the United States, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Bolivia, Uruguay, and Guatemala concerning Mexico would be resumed at the Biltmore Hotel in New York, at 2 o'clock on Wednesday afternoon.
docs.abstract: Lansing announces that "very definite policy" has been decided upon, after consulting Wilson; appeal ready

headline.main: NATIONS AGREED ON MEXICO PLAN; APPEAL READY; " Very Definite Policy" Decided On, Lansing Announces After Consulting the President. MORE HOPE FOR PEACE Latin-Americans Meet Here Tomorrow to Give Formal Sanction to Joint Program. THINK PRESSURE WILL WIN And Armed Intervention Will Not Be Necessary -- General Scott Meets Villa at the Border. NATIONS AGREED ON MEXICO PLAN

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11. -- Elesio Arredondo, head of the Carranza agency here, addressed today a note to Secretary Lansing, in which the United States was virtually warned against any interference with the course of the revolution in Mexico, either...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11. -- Elesio Arredondo, head of the Carranza agency here, addressed today a note to Secretary Lansing, in which the United States was virtually warned against any interference with the course of the revolution in Mexico, either without or with the co-operation of Latin-American Governments.

headline.main: CARRANZA ISSUES ROUND OF PROTESTS; Notes Sent to This and Latin-American Nations Warning Against Mediation.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12. -- Secretary Lansing will make no response to the letter sent to him yesterday by Agent Arredondo of the Carranza Government in behalf of Carranza, in which the United States was practically warned that the Carransistas would not...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12. -- Secretary Lansing will make no response to the letter sent to him yesterday by Agent Arredondo of the Carranza Government in behalf of Carranza, in which the United States was practically warned that the Carransistas would not tolerate any interference in their affairs by any American nation.
docs.abstract: Carranza note to be ignored by U. S.; Latin-Amer. nations free to drop out; Argentina's answer surprises U. S.; Carranza forbids conference of his agents in Washington

headline.main: WILSON TO IGNORE CARRANZA NOTE; Mexico Program to be Carried On, with Latin-American Nations Free to Drop Out.
